intro: Spennera panicularis, commonly known as the panicle spennera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, panicle-like inflorescences that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Spennera panicularis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps.
